channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2024020566
item.description:
Report X-2024020566

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car appeared to have been hard coupled from humping operations that caused a crumpling of the B end left side pushing the truck assembly up to the first hopper. This crumpling caused a tear in the side of the car approximately 1' long by 1-2" wide.

item.title: Report X-2024020612
item.description:
Report X-2024020612

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: HARRISON
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler picked up the package assuming it was a wet box from rain and then set it on the rollers. I went and noticed a leak under the package and quickly noticed it was leaking and saw that it was a hazmat. I identified the type of hazmat being alcohol and got a tote to avoid any major spillage to continue. DescribePack: Multiple bottles of alcohol had loose caps but only one was very loose which caused the package to leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: It was placed so that it would not leak and then had a tote put underneath so anymore would not spill
